alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 07 at 2:00PM MDT until May 08 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 8 PM TODAY FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHERN AND EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MONDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Strong west to southwest winds, low humidity, seasonably warm temperatures, and an unstable airmass will continue through early evening. As a result, critical fire weather conditions remain likely below snowpack, primarily over the eastern half of New Mexico. Critical fire weather conditions will cease late this evening as winds diminish, but will return across the Northeast Highlands on Monday as southwest winds increase once again. Another round of critical fire weather conditions are possible on Tuesday across northeast New Mexico, then will become more widespread on Wednesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT MONDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands (123) through 8 pm MDT today, then again Monday afternoon through Monday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph today. On Monday, southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts to near 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent each day. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
